Job.JobTitle: Lebanon City Schools: LJHS Volleyball Coach Assistant (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position ***2026-2027
Job.JobDescription:
The Lebanon City Schools: LJHS Volleyball Coach Assistant (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 role at Lebanon Junior High School emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Lebanon City Schools: LJHS Volleyball Coach Assistant (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At Lebanon Junior High School, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The Lebanon City Schools: LJHS Volleyball Coach Assistant (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 reviews performance with the team, helping athletes learn how to analyze both successes and mistakes in a constructive way.
The role extends into community and family engagement. Coaches represent Lebanon Junior High School at games, parent meetings, and potential youth outreach events. The Lebanon City Schools: LJHS Volleyball Coach Assistant (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 may help host clinics or camps, encourage younger students to try the sport, and provide information about expectations to families who are new to the program. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.
Athlete support is ongoing. The Lebanon City Schools: LJHS Volleyball Coach Assistant (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Lebanon City Schools: LJHS Volleyball Coach Assistant (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at Lebanon Junior High School.

The Volleyball Coach JV-Boys position at Richie Wildenhaus is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Volleyball Coach JV-Boys is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Richie Wildenhaus, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Volleyball Coach JV-Boys encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Volleyball Coach JV-Boys also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Volleyball Coach JV-Boys role at Richie Wildenhaus is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At OF HIGH SCHOOL, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Assistant Baseball Coach (Internal Only) demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Assistant Baseball Coach (Internal Only) follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Assistant Baseball Coach (Internal Only) at OF HIGH SCHOOL allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

The Supplemental - MS Boys Track at Licking Valley Middle School is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Supplemental - MS Boys Track plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Licking Valley Middle School reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Supplemental - MS Boys Track expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Supplemental - MS Boys Track supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Supplemental - MS Boys Track may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Licking Valley Middle School. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

The Supplemental - MS Assistant Girls Track at Licking Valley Middle School is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. This position calls for a coach who is organized, reflective, and committed to continuous improvement, both for themselves and for their athletes. The role blends hands‑on coaching with program administration and relationship‑building.
From a coaching standpoint, the Supplemental - MS Assistant Girls Track is responsible for teaching the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport in a way that is accessible to student‑athletes. Practices are planned to include progressive skill work, position‑specific instruction, and opportunities for athletes to apply learning in controlled scrimmage situations. The coach pays attention to pacing and variety so that sessions remain engaging while still challenging students to stretch their comfort zones.
Culture is a central focus of this job. At Licking Valley Middle School, the Supplemental - MS Assistant Girls Track helps create a team environment where respect, honesty, and effort are expected. The coach sets clear standards regarding communication, attendance, and sportsmanship, and works with athletes to understand why these standards matter. When expectations are not met, the coach responds fairly, explaining consequences and encouraging athletes to learn from mistakes.
The position also requires responsiveness to student needs. Coaches remain aware of the emotional and academic pressures students face and adjust support accordingly. Checking in with athletes, acknowledging their efforts, and partnering with school staff all contribute to a positive experience. The Supplemental - MS Assistant Girls Track may assist in connecting students with resources when additional support is needed.
Outside of direct coaching, the role involves tasks such as coordinating with officials and opponents, assisting with scheduling, and managing team communication channels. The coach must be punctual, prepared, and detail‑oriented, ensuring that events run smoothly and that the team represents Licking Valley Middle School well at home and away.
Safety remains an ongoing responsibility. The Supplemental - MS Assistant Girls Track follows district guidelines, maintains necessary certifications, and emphasizes proper warm‑up routines and technique to minimize risk of injury. This comprehensive approach to coaching allows student‑athletes to pursue their goals in a structured environment that prioritizes learning, well‑being, and long‑term success.

The Supplemental - MS Boys Assistant Track role at Licking Valley Middle School is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Supplemental - MS Boys Assistant Track is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Licking Valley Middle School, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The Supplemental - MS Boys Assistant Track sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Licking Valley Middle School, the Supplemental - MS Boys Assistant Track is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the Supplemental - MS Boys Assistant Track at Licking Valley Middle School is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

The Supplemental - Freshman Baseball position at Licking Valley High School is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the Supplemental - Freshman Baseball works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The Supplemental - Freshman Baseball at Licking Valley High School sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At Licking Valley High School, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The Supplemental - Freshman Baseball encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The Supplemental - Freshman Baseball is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the Supplemental - Freshman Baseball position at Licking Valley High School is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.

Job.JobTitle: Head Boys Tennis Coach - Ida B. Wells HS - 25/26 SY - District Athletics
Job.JobDescription:
Position Details Portland Public Schools (PPS) is seeking talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences to lead change and inspire PPS students. At PPS, every employee, despite having different roles, is an educator. We hope to attract talented educators who model the core PPS Educator Essentials. With the District’s focus on eliminating systemic racism and its adverse impact on student learning, we seek to hire individuals who bring to our district a deep commitment to racial equity and social justice.
The District is committed to equal opportunity and nondiscrimination in all its educational and employment activities. The District prohibits discrimination based on perceived or actual race; national or ethnic origin; color; sex; religion; age; sexual orientation; gender expression or identity; pregnancy; marital status; veteran’s status; familial status; economic status or source of income; mental or physical disability or perceived disability; or military service.
504 Coordinator: Marquita Guzman,mguzman@pps.net, 971-393-8633 ADA Coordinator: Jey Buno, jbuno@pps.net, 503-916-3360 Civil Rights Director: Dr. Bobby Cruz, bcruz@pps.net, 503-839-3660
Accessibility Statement
Conflict/Complaint Resolution Process
DISTRICT MISSION:
At PPS, our goal is that by the end of elementary, middle and high school every student by name is meeting or exceeding academic standards and is fully prepared to make productive life decisions.
DISTRICT PROFILE:
To obtain more information about our district, schools, learning environment and programs, please go to https://www.pps.net/Domain/265.
Key points of the job description for a Varsity Head Coach:
High ethical and professional standards. Direct a successful grade 9-12 program and oversee all facets of an entire community youth program. 3 years of High School coaching experience Be a role model for high school student-athletes. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports by encouraging student-athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program. Lead student-athletes in the support of other Portland Public Schools athletics and activities.
The Head Coach will be responsible for the following:
Manage all aspects of the high school program including training, practice schedules and routines. Hire and oversee a staff of assistant coaches Provide regular communication with parents/families Regularly track the academic progress of all student athletes in the program and facilitate necessary supports to ensure their academic eligibility. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports and encourage athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program for athletics.
All new hired coaches will need to complete the following prior to employment:
NFHS/ASEP Certification First Aid Card (CPR and AED trained) District Fingerprinting/Criminal check Completion of OSAA Concussion Test Completion of ODE Steroid Test Completion of OSAA Heat Test *Head Up Football *Cheer and Dance/Drill Spirit Safety Training Completion of Portland Public School District paperwork and trainings.
Applicant will be asked to apply online at our website and include the following:
A cover letter detailing your experience. A current resume. A minimum of three letters of recommendation/reference.
All PPS job offers are contingent on the satisfactory completion of a background check, including fingerprinting and criminal records.
Salary Range - $6100.00 to $10,000.00
* There is no compensation for summer and out of season workouts.
Job.Experience: 3 years

Job.JobTitle: Softball - Assistant Coach, Sprague High School
Job.JobDescription:
The Softball - Assistant Coach, Sprague High School role at SPRAGUE HIGH SCHOOL is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Softball - Assistant Coach, Sprague High School is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at SPRAGUE HIGH SCHOOL are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Softball - Assistant Coach, Sprague High School listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Softball - Assistant Coach, Sprague High School encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Softball - Assistant Coach, Sprague High School follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At SPRAGUE HIGH SCHOOL, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Softball - Assistant Coach, Sprague High School at SPRAGUE HIGH SCHOOL, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.

Head Boys Volleyball Coach - E698SY2526 HILLSBORO SD 1J Century High School - Hillsboro, Oregon Open in Google Maps Job Details Job ID:5409998 Application Deadline:Posted until filled Re-Posted:Jan 05, 2026 8:00 AM (UTC)
Starting Date:Immediately
Job Description
E698SY2526 | Head Boys Volleyball Coach | Century High School | Reposted Until Filled
GENERAL DUTIES:
Support the Hillsboro School District athletic objective, policy of interscholastic athletics, and Hillsboro School District Athletic Code. The District believes that extra-curricular activities are an integral part of school life. All students, regardless of their ability, should take part if possible to be able to grow physically, intellectually, and socially through participation. Coaches organize and conduct the athletic programs to meet the needs of the school district and their participants.
ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:
Experience in and/or knowledge of the sport, coaching techniques, and student supervision. Ability and willingness to effectively communicate in verbal and written modes with student/athletes, parents, assistant coaches, and other school staff. Ability and willingness to perform coaching responsibilities in accordance with school and District procedures and policies. Must have current CPR/First Aid certification. Must have current Concussion Management and other trainings required by the OSAA. Maintain integrity of confidential information relating to students, staff, or District patrons. The ability to work harmoniously with others and collaborate solutions to concerns. Successfully pass background check.
To view the full job description please visit the following link: Head Coach
Position Type:Other Job Requirements Citizenship, residency or work visa required Contact Information Applications Office 3083 NE 49th Place Hillsboro, Oregon 97124 Phone: 503-844-1500 Email: applicationsoffice@hsd.k12.or.us Map

Job.JobTitle: 1.0 FTE Assistant Women's Golf Coach – Summit High School – Regular
Job.JobDescription:
Bend-La Pine Schools is committed to the principle of equity. Equity supersedes the notion of equality, where all are treated the same. Pursuing equity requires the removal of barriers and the promotion of inclusive practices so that all students fully benefit. The principle of equity will inform all BLS policies, regulations, programs, operations, practices, and resource allocations.
Studies have shown that some individuals (women and people of color, for example) are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single qualification in a job description. Our goal is to find the best candidate for the position, and we acknowledge that that candidate may be an individual from a less traditional background. We encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of our qualifications described. If you are unsure whether you meet the qualifications of a position, or how this would be determined, please feel free to contact Human Resources to discuss your application.
As you prepare to submit your application for employment, please note that all consideration of experience for the position and initial salary placements will be based upon the information you submit with your original application. Resumes must be detailed and verifiable for successful experience credit, any information provided to Bend-La Pine Schools at a later date will not be the basis for adjustments in salary placement.
Bend La Pine Schools Assistant Coaching Details
General Job Qualifications and Key Responsibilities of the Assistant Coach: Hold high ethical and professional standards. Be an appropriate role model for high school student-athletes. Hold high expectations and accountability both behaviorally and academically for all student-athletes and coaching staff. Ability to develop, articulate, and implement a vision for your individual discipline. Ability to work in a cooperative and harmonious manner in an educationally based, school-wide athletic program. Experience in the specific discipline at high school level preferred. Be relationship/process oriented. Be involved in fundraising for the program. Communicate effectively with head coach and athletic director. Be an advocate for the multi-sport athlete. Be a supporter of the head coach and the direction they are taking the program. 1. NFHS Fundamentals of Coaching (one-time requirement, previous completion will be recognized) 2. Concussion in Sports (yearly) 3. Heat Illness Prevention (every 4 years) District Background check 4. Appearance and Performance Enhancing Drugs and Substances Training (every 4 years) 5. Heads up certification (Yearly) (Football only) 6. First Aid/CPR/AED (every 2 years) (paid coaches only) 7. Hire and oversee a staff of assistant coaches Provide regular communication with parents/families Regularly track the academic progress of all student-athletes in the program and facilitate necessary supports to ensure their academic eligibility. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports and encourage athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program for athletics.
All new hired coaches will need to complete the following prior to employment:
NFHS/ASEP Certification First Aid Card (CPR and AED trained) District Fingerprinting/Criminal check Completion of OSAA Concussion Test Completion of ODE Steroid Test Completion of OSAA Heat Test *Head Up Football *Cheer and Dance/Drill Spirit Safety Training Completion of Portland Public School District paperwork and trainings.
Applicant will be asked to apply online at our website and include the following:
A cover letter detailing your experience. A current resume. A minimum of three letters of recommendation/reference.
All PPS job offers are contingent on the satisfactory completion of a background check, including fingerprinting and criminal records.
Salary Range - $6100.00 to $10,000.00
* There is no compensation for summer and out of season workouts.
Portland Public Schools (PPS) is seeking talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences to lead change and inspire PPS students. At PPS, every employee, despite having different roles, is an educator. We hope to attract talented educators who model the core PPS Educator Essentials. Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football position at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football role at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.
Job.Location: PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL - West Chester, Pennsylvania
Job.CompanyDescription: West Chester Area School D. coaching jobs

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. This position calls for a coach who is organized, reflective, and committed to continuous improvement, both for themselves and for their athletes. The role blends hands‑on coaching with program administration and relationship‑building.
From a coaching standpoint, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer is responsible for teaching the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport in a way that is accessible to student‑athletes. Practices are planned to include progressive skill work, position‑specific instruction, and opportunities for athletes to apply learning in controlled scrimmage situations. The coach pays attention to pacing and variety so that sessions remain engaging while still challenging students to stretch their comfort zones.
Culture is a central focus of this job. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer helps create a team environment where respect, honesty, and effort are expected. The coach sets clear standards regarding communication, attendance, and sportsmanship, and works with athletes to understand why these standards matter. When expectations are not met, the coach responds fairly, explaining consequences and encouraging athletes to learn from mistakes.
The position also requires responsiveness to student needs. Coaches remain aware of the emotional and academic pressures students face and adjust support accordingly. Checking in with athletes, acknowledging their efforts, and partnering with school staff all contribute to a positive experience. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer may assist in connecting students with resources when additional support is needed.
Outside of direct coaching, the role involves tasks such as coordinating with officials and opponents, assisting with scheduling, and managing team communication channels. The coach must be punctual, prepared, and detail‑oriented, ensuring that events run smoothly and that the team represents PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL well at home and away.
Safety remains an ongoing responsibility. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer follows district guidelines, maintains necessary certifications, and emphasizes proper warm‑up routines and technique to minimize risk of injury. This comprehensive approach to coaching allows student‑athletes to pursue their goals in a structured environment that prioritizes learning, well‑being, and long‑term success.
Job.Location: PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL - West Chester, Pennsylvania
Job.CompanyDescription: West Chester Area School D. coaching jobs

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer position at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer position at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.
Job.Location: PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL - West Chester, Pennsylvania
Job.CompanyDescription: West Chester Area School D. coaching jobs

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - HEAD Coach - Field Hockey
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - HEAD Coach - Field Hockey at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - HEAD Coach - Field Hockey manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - HEAD Coach - Field Hockey demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - HEAD Coach - Field Hockey follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - HEAD Coach - Field Hockey at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

Job.JobDescription: Position Summary The Head Coach for Girls Flag Football is responsible for leading and developing a competitive, educationally grounded, and character-driven athletic program at Erie High School. The Head Coach will foster positive communication and collaboration among Erie Public Schools, student-athletes, families, and community partners. This individual is expected to promote academic excellence, sportsmanship, and good citizenship while serving as a positive role model and mentor in alignment with PIAA Girls Flag Football standards. Term of Employment Seasonal PIAA Sanctioned Sport 12-month position School / Location: Erie High School Reporting Relationships: Reports directly to the Director of Athletics and the Building Principal. Qualifications - Prior coaching experience in Girls Flag Football, football, or a related sport preferred - Thorough knowledge of PIAA bylaws and NFHS Girls Flag Football rules - Demonstrated ability to plan and implement effective practice plans and competitive strategies - Strong organizational, leadership, and communication skills - Ability to motivate, mentor, and develop student-athletes both athletically and academically - Experience working with urban student populations preferred - Ability to support and transition student-athletes to the next competitive level - Working knowledge of Erie Public Schools policies and procedures - Must obtain and maintain required FBI, PA Criminal, and Child Abuse Clearances PIAA / NFHS Compliance & Expectations The Head Coach must demonstrate a thorough understanding of and strict adherence to all Pennsylvania Interscholastic Athletic Association (PIAA) bylaws, policies, and regulations, as well as all National Federation of State High School Associations (NFHS) Girls Flag Football rules. The Head Coach is responsible for ensuring that all aspects of the Girls Flag Football program�including practices, competitions, athlete eligibility, conduct, safety protocols, and coaching behavior�are fully compliant with PIAA, NFHS, and Erie Public Schools requirements. The Head Coach must: - Maintain current knowledge of PIAA bylaws and NFHS rule updates - Complete all required PIAA, PDE, and NFHS coaching education and sport-specific certifications - Enforce rules related to eligibility, transfers, practice limitations, and seasons of participation - Model and promote sportsmanship and ethical conduct in accordance with NFHS standards - Ensure student-athlete safety through proper supervision and adherence to NFHS safety guidelines - Cooperate fully with the Athletic Director and Building Principal on all compliance matters Failure to comply with PIAA or NFHS regulations may result in disciplinary action, up to and including removal from coaching duties. Essential Duties and Responsibilities - Supervise and instruct student-athletes in compliance with NFHS rules and PIAA regulations - Plan, organize, and conduct practices, games, and competitions - Monitor and support academic eligibility, attendance, and conduct of student-athletes - Ensure all athletes are properly cleared, rostered, and eligible - Maintain accurate records, inventories, and equipment control - Ensure all uniforms and equipment are accounted for prior to stipend disbursement - Communicate effectively with athletes, families, and District administration - Promote safety, sportsmanship, leadership, and positive character development Off-Season Responsibilities - Participate in and support program fundraisers, as applicable - Attend or organize off-season camps, leagues, and development opportunities - Organize and supervise off-season open gym and weight room sessions - Develop off-season practice plans and instructional programming Professional Expectations The Head Coach will represent Erie Public Schools with the highest standards of professionalism, ethical conduct, and integrity at all times. Other Duties - Attend staff meetings, clinics, and professional development activities - Perform other related duties as assigned by the Athletic Director, Building Principal, or other administrator Evaluation Performance will be evaluated by the Director of Athletics and/or the Building Principal. This list intended to be illustrative rather than complete and serves to show major duties and responsibilities and does not express or imply that these are the only duties performed by the incumbent in this position. The employee will be required to perform any other position-related duties requested by the supervisor.

Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Softball Coach (2 Vacancies) position at Cedar Cliff High School is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Assistant Softball Coach (2 Vacancies) is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Cedar Cliff High School, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Assistant Softball Coach (2 Vacancies) encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Assistant Softball Coach (2 Vacancies) also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Assistant Softball Coach (2 Vacancies) role at Cedar Cliff High School is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

Job.JobDescription:
The Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach at Manheim Township is a high‑engagement coaching role that calls for energy, clear communication, and a steady presence for student‑athletes. This position is built for a coach who enjoys being actively involved in every aspect of the program, from leading warm‑ups and teaching tactics to meeting with families and coordinating logistics. The coach is expected to bring consistency and enthusiasm to each interaction with the team.
Practices led by the Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach are structured and purposeful. They begin with appropriate warm‑ups, transition into focused skill work, and conclude with competitive or situational activities that resemble live play. The coach introduces concepts in manageable steps and checks for understanding, encouraging athletes to ask questions and learn the reasoning behind drills and strategies. This approach helps athletes become smarter, more confident players.
Motivation is another key component of the job. Coaches at Manheim Township use positive reinforcement, high yet realistic expectations, and clear feedback to help athletes push themselves. The Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach recognizes effort and improvement, not just outcomes, and supports athletes through setbacks. This creates an environment where students are willing to take risks and grow.
The role also includes a strong communication element. The coach keeps families informed about schedules, travel, and program expectations, and responds to questions in a respectful, timely manner. Within the school, the Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach collaborates with administrators and teachers to support students’ academic responsibilities, reinforcing that success in the classroom is essential.
Finally, the position requires adherence to safety and policy standards. The Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach maintains appropriate supervision ratios, follows guidelines on equipment use, and ensures that emergency procedures are understood and practiced. The coach models appropriate conduct toward officials and opponents, reinforcing that competing with integrity is a core expectation at Manheim Township. This comprehensive role is well suited to coaches who are organized, student‑focused, and eager to contribute to a strong athletic tradition.

Job.JobTitle: Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions)
Job.JobDescription:
The Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) at Avon Grove Middle School is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. This position calls for a coach who is organized, reflective, and committed to continuous improvement, both for themselves and for their athletes. The role blends hands‑on coaching with program administration and relationship‑building.
From a coaching standpoint, the Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) is responsible for teaching the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport in a way that is accessible to student‑athletes. Practices are planned to include progressive skill work, position‑specific instruction, and opportunities for athletes to apply learning in controlled scrimmage situations. The coach pays attention to pacing and variety so that sessions remain engaging while still challenging students to stretch their comfort zones.
Culture is a central focus of this job. At Avon Grove Middle School, the Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) helps create a team environment where respect, honesty, and effort are expected. The coach sets clear standards regarding communication, attendance, and sportsmanship, and works with athletes to understand why these standards matter. When expectations are not met, the coach responds fairly, explaining consequences and encouraging athletes to learn from mistakes.
The position also requires responsiveness to student needs. Coaches remain aware of the emotional and academic pressures students face and adjust support accordingly. Checking in with athletes, acknowledging their efforts, and partnering with school staff all contribute to a positive experience. The Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) may assist in connecting students with resources when additional support is needed.
Outside of direct coaching, the role involves tasks such as coordinating with officials and opponents, assisting with scheduling, and managing team communication channels. The coach must be punctual, prepared, and detail‑oriented, ensuring that events run smoothly and that the team represents Avon Grove Middle School well at home and away.
Safety remains an ongoing responsibility. The Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) follows district guidelines, maintains necessary certifications, and emphasizes proper warm‑up routines and technique to minimize risk of injury. This comprehensive approach to coaching allows student‑athletes to pursue their goals in a structured environment that prioritizes learning, well‑being, and long‑term success.

Job.JobDescription:
Position Title: Head Junior High Field Hockey Coach
Job Goal: This position involves coaching, mentoring, and guiding student-athletes in individual skill development and team strategies. The coach will also be responsible for fostering a positive and inclusive team culture, ensuring the safety and well-being of players, and always representing the school professionally.
Qualifications: Minimum of 3 years coaching experience (head coaching preferred) Proven coaching techniques and in-depth knowledge, including rules, strategies, and district and PIAA regulations Strong communication, organizational, and leadership skills Ability to foster effective relationships with administrators, staff, students, parents, and governing bodies Commitment to academic and personal development of student-athletes Ability to assess and develop players and coaches Professional demeanor and motivational leadership Effective communicator with strong human relations skills Commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion Willingness to uphold school policies and work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends Availability to meet with students and parents outside of instructional hours A head coach/assistant coach must be dedicated to organizing and maintaining a structured off-season workout program that supports the ongoing development of their athletes. This involves planning and supervising conditioning, skill-building, and strength training sessions to ensure progress throughout the year and team readiness.

Application Deadline: The position will remain open until the appropriate candidate is selected.

The Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach at Southside High is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Southside High reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Southside High. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

Job.JobDescription:
The 2025-2026 Temporary Employee - Head Boys B-Team Baseball Coach - Stratford High role at Berkeley County is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the 2025-2026 Temporary Employee - Head Boys B-Team Baseball Coach - Stratford High is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Berkeley County, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The 2025-2026 Temporary Employee - Head Boys B-Team Baseball Coach - Stratford High sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Berkeley County, the 2025-2026 Temporary Employee - Head Boys B-Team Baseball Coach - Stratford High is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the 2025-2026 Temporary Employee - Head Boys B-Team Baseball Coach - Stratford High at Berkeley County is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

Job.JobDescription:
The Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School role at Brigette McSheehan emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At Brigette McSheehan, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at Brigette McSheehan.

For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Soccer - Varsity Assistant Coach (Girls) -2026 role at School District Five of Lexington and Richland Counties is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.
Job.EmployerFullName: School District Five of Lexington and Richland Counties

Job.JobDescription:
The Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 at Dutch Fork High School is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At Dutch Fork High School, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at Dutch Fork High School operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent Dutch Fork High School with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 role at Dutch Fork High School.

The Assistant Athletic Director position at Chapin High School is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Assistant Athletic Director is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Chapin High School, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Assistant Athletic Director encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Assistant Athletic Director also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Assistant Athletic Director role at Chapin High School is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

Job.JobTitle: Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys
Job.JobDescription:
The Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys at Dutch Fork High School is a high‑engagement coaching role that calls for energy, clear communication, and a steady presence for student‑athletes. This position is built for a coach who enjoys being actively involved in every aspect of the program, from leading warm‑ups and teaching tactics to meeting with families and coordinating logistics. The coach is expected to bring consistency and enthusiasm to each interaction with the team.
Practices led by the Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys are structured and purposeful. They begin with appropriate warm‑ups, transition into focused skill work, and conclude with competitive or situational activities that resemble live play. The coach introduces concepts in manageable steps and checks for understanding, encouraging athletes to ask questions and learn the reasoning behind drills and strategies. This approach helps athletes become smarter, more confident players.
Motivation is another key component of the job. Coaches at Dutch Fork High School use positive reinforcement, high yet realistic expectations, and clear feedback to help athletes push themselves. The Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys recognizes effort and improvement, not just outcomes, and supports athletes through setbacks. This creates an environment where students are willing to take risks and grow.
The role also includes a strong communication element. The coach keeps families informed about schedules, travel, and program expectations, and responds to questions in a respectful, timely manner. Within the school, the Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys collaborates with administrators and teachers to support students’ academic responsibilities, reinforcing that success in the classroom is essential.
Finally, the position requires adherence to safety and policy standards. The Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys maintains appropriate supervision ratios, follows guidelines on equipment use, and ensures that emergency procedures are understood and practiced. The coach models appropriate conduct toward officials and opponents, reinforcing that competing with integrity is a core expectation at Dutch Fork High School. This comprehensive role is well suited to coaches who are organized, student‑focused, and eager to contribute to a strong athletic tradition.

Reports To: School Athletic Director and/or School Administration Job Summary: Rock Hill Schools is seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Athletic Coach to lead, motivate, and develop athletes to reach their highest potential in both skill and character. The Athletic Coach will plan and implement practice sessions, guide athletes in training and competition, promote teamwork and sportsmanship, and ensure the health and safety of all participants. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute effective training programs and practice plans. Instruct athletes in the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport. Evaluate athlete performance and provide constructive feedback. Foster a positive team culture that emphasizes discipline, effort, integrity, and mutual respect. Ensure adherence to all rules and regulations set by the school, league, or governing body. Monitor the physical and mental condition of athletes, including injury prevention and first response. Coordinate with assistant coaches, athletic trainers, and other staff. Communicate regularly with athletes, parents, and administration. Attend all practices, games, meetings, and required events. Maintain equipment and inventory related to the specific sport. Serve as a role model and mentor to student-athletes. Qualifications: Proven coaching experience in [specific sport, e.g., basketball, soccer, track, etc.]. Knowledge of sport-specific techniques, rules, and strategies. Excellent leadership, motivational, and organizational skills. Strong interpersonal and communication abilities. Satisfactory background report Preferred: Experience coaching at the [high school/collegiate/professional] level. Relevant coaching certification (e.g., NFHS, USA Coaching, etc.) Start Date: Determined by Human Resources. PRE-ONBOARDING REQUIREMENTS: As a condition of employment and prior to onboarding, the district will conduct a criminal history background check. The recommended candidate will be required to provide personal information necessary to complete the background check such as date of birth, gender, and race to remain in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. DISCLAIMER: The District reserves the right to modify job postings and/or job descriptions at any time to meet organizational needs. EEOC STATEMENT: Rock Hill Schools provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
